title: Kashmiri Cuisine
short_description: Famous for the elaborate Wazwan feast, rich meat dishes like Rogan Josh, and the delicate use of saffron and dry fruits.
long_description:
Kashmiri cuisine, often referred to as Wazwan, is a regal culinary tradition from the beautiful Kashmir Valley. Known for its rich, aromatic flavors, it heavily utilizes yogurt, saffron, Kashmiri red chilies (for color rather than heat), and dry fruits.

The cuisine is heavily influenced by Central Asian and Persian traditions. Meat, particularly lamb/mutton, plays a central role, cooked in various styles ranging from the milk-based Yakhni to the fiery Rogan Josh. The painstaking preparation of a Wazwan, a multi-course meal often consisting of up to 36 dishes, is considered an art form.

signature_dishes.name: Rogan Josh
signature_dishes.short_description: A slow-cooked lamb curry with a rich red gravy flavored with Kashmiri red chilies and fennel.

signature_dishes.name: Yakhni
signature_dishes.short_description: A mild, yogurt-based mutton curry seasoned with fennel and cardamom.

signature_dishes.name: Dum Aloo
signature_dishes.short_description: Potatoes deep-fried and slow-cooked in a spicy red gravy.

signature_dishes.name: Kahwa
signature_dishes.short_description: A traditional green tea brewed with saffron, cinnamon, cardamom, and almond slivers.
signature_dishes.best_place_to_try: Any local chai stall or house boat

signature_dishes.name: Goshtaba
signature_dishes.short_description: Soft meatballs cooked in a yogurt gravy, traditionally served as the last savory dish of a Wazwan.

top_restaurants.name: Ahdoos
top_restaurants.notes: One of the oldest and most legendary spots for authentic Kashmiri Wazwan.

top_restaurants.name: Mughal Darbar
top_restaurants.notes: Famous for its generous portions and traditional ambiance.

top_restaurants.name: Shamyana Restaurant
top_restaurants.notes: Offers a great view of Dal Lake along with delicious local food.

best_markets_and_streets.name: Khayam Chowk
best_markets_and_streets.how_to_reach: Easily accessible by auto or taxi in Srinagar.

best_markets_and_streets.name: Lal Chowk Street Food
best_markets_and_streets.what_to_try: Nader Monje (Lotus stem fritters) and Halwa Paratha

food_festivals.name: Wazwan Festival
food_festivals.description: Celebrations of the traditional multi-course meal often held in hotels and by tourism boards.

dining_etiquette: Wazwan is traditionally eaten seated on the floor in groups of four from a large copper platter (Traami). Eating with hands is customary and considered respectful.
seasonal_specialties: Harissa (a slow-cooked lamb porridge) is a winter breakfast staple.
recommended_precautions_for_travellers: Drink bottled water. Be cautious with street food hygiene if you have a sensitive stomach.
